com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.interfaces

Interface SendingService

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable, SoftStoppable

    public interface SendingService
extends Runnable, SoftStoppable
    The SendingService class is the entry-point for sending objects over the network.

    This Runnable is meant to be run in a separate Thread and to be (sort of) forgotten about. It is used within a Connection.

    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • addSendDoneCallback

        void addSendDoneCallback(Callback<Object> callback)
        Adds a Callback, that will be executed, if the object is sent
        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback, that should be held internally.

      • overrideSendingQueue

        void overrideSendingQueue(BlockingQueue<Object> linkedBlockingQueue)
        Allows to override the internally saved instance of the BlockingQueue, that contains the Objects that should be send.

        This means, if set to a custom instance, you can provide custom Objects to be send

        Parameters:
        linkedBlockingQueue - the new BlockingQueue

      • setup

        void setup(OutputStream outputStream,
           BlockingQueue<Object> toSendFrom)
        Sets up this SendingService.

        This means, internal dependencies will be resolved and this SendingService is ready to run.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - the OutputStream, this SendingService should write to.
        toSendFrom - the BlockingQueue, that the Objects to send should be taken from

      • started

        Awaiting started()
        Returns a synchronization mechanism, that allows to wait until the SendingService is setup.

        This mechanism stops blocking if the SendingService is setup und running.

        Returns:
        the Synchronization mechanism.

      • setConnectionIDSupplier

        void setConnectionIDSupplier(java.util.function.Supplier<String> supplier)
        Allows you to set a supplier, that defines the ConnectionID.
        Parameters:
        supplier - the Supplier, that creates the ConnectionID

      • isSetup

        boolean isSetup()
        This method returns whether or not this SendingService is setup or not.

        If it is setup, it can successfully run. To set it up, call setup(OutputStream, BlockingQueue).

        Returns:
        true, if it was setup, else false
        See Also:
        setup(OutputStream, BlockingQueue)
